newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Rugby league-Toovey to lead New South Wales in Origin clash.
newsitem.headline: Rugby league-Toovey to lead New South Wales in Origin clash.

text.p: Manly's Geoff Toovey has been named as New South Wales captain for the State of Origin rugby league match against Queensland in Brisbane on May 28.
Toovey was given the role after Sydney City star Brad Fittler was ruled out with a broken thumb.
Both New South Wales and Queensland selectors named their sides on Monday.
Sydney City halfback Adrian Lam will lead Queensland.

New South Wales - Tim Brasher (Balmain), Rod Wishart (Illawarra), Terry Hill (Manly), Paul McGregor (Illawarra), Jamie Ainscough (St George), Jim Dymock (Parramatta), Geoff Toovey (capt, Manly), Nik Kosef (Manly), Steve Menzies (Manly), Adam Muir (Newcastle), Paul Harragon (Newcastle), Andrew Johns (Newcastle), Mark Carroll (Manly). Res: David Fairleigh (North Sydney), Dean Pay (Parramatta), John Simon (Parramatta), Ken McGuinness (Western Suburbs).

Queensland - Robbie O'Davis (Newcastle), Brett Dallas (North Sydney), Matt Sing (Sydney City), Mark Coyne (St George), Danny Moore (Manly), Ben Ikin (North Sydney), Adrian Lam (capt, Sydney City), Wayne Bartrim (St George), Billy Moore (North Sydney), Gary Larson (North Sydney), Craig Smith (Illawarra), James Goddard (Gold Coast), Neil Tierney (Manly). Res: Jason Smith (Parramatta), Jeremy Schloss (Gold Coast), Tony Hearn (St George), Stuart Kelly (Parramatta).
